ref: 17 *akkha ʻ sacking, bag, net ʼ. [Perh. conn. Sk. ákṣi -- , if Pa. akkhika -- n. ʻ mesh of a net ʼ < ʻ *having eyes ʼ]
S. akho m. ʻ mesh of a net ʼ;
P. akkhā m. ʻ one end of a bag or sack thrown over a beast of burden ʼ;
P. akkhā m. ʻ one end of a bag or sack thrown over a beast of burden ʼ;
Bi. ākhā, ã̄khā ʻ grain bag carried by pack animal ʼ;
H. ākhā m. ʻ one of a pair of grain bags used as panniers ʼ;
M. ã̄khā m. ʻ netting in which coco -- nuts, &c., are carried ʼ, ā̆khẽ n. ʻ half a bullock -- load ʼ.
